website_summaries.verdict: Sonos took their category-defining PLAY:1 speaker and added the only thing it was missing: native support for Amazon’s smart assistant, Alexa. It’s the best-sounding smart speaker in its price range if you can live with a few quirks.
pros: Supports Sonos’ multi-room audio feature and is built to the same specifications as the PLAY:1
Supports multiple audio streaming services such as Pandora
cons: Voice recognition is not as consistent as it is with Amazon’s own devices
No support for Bluetooth or 3.5mm cable connection

customer_reviews.title: Terrible investment
customer_reviews.text: Music regularly skips and/or stops completely. I have the fastest Internet speed available, my router is new (2017) and located in the same room as two of the speakers that frequently cut out (although they all do). Sometimes, speakers disappear from my account completely and I have to individually re-add them. These are common, known issues on which Sonos’ will blame your router—either being too outdated or too new.
customer_reviews.author: J Robinson

customer_reviews.title: sonos has eliminated functionality that i depended on when i purchased it
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this speaker in 2017 to use with my PC and the songs loaded on the PC. but the latest update from sonos has removed the ability to MANAGE DEVICES from the PC application. this is a major impact for me, i do not own or wish to own a mobile device to perform this function. BEWARE, sonos forever "owns" your speaker and can without warning change the way it operates in your setup. VERY DISSATISFIED with the sonos company
customer_reviews.author: no-name

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it, and don't forget their TrueTuning — and think about stereo before deciding what product to buy!
customer_reviews.text: Just killer good! Perfect for my bedroom! Bought one, wanted stereo so I bought another, and then... and then... I tried their TrueTuning technology and it's so amazing it dropped me dead! Killer! I've never heard a better stereo field! Note that with competing products, you can buy two but you get two mono speakers. Sonos One pairs up for full stereo! I got the Sonos 5.1 in my living room and pair of Sonos Ones in my bedroom and I ain't giving it back!
customer_reviews.author: Lovehound

customer_reviews.title: Too many issues!!
customer_reviews.text: Brought a stereo pair at Best Buy and the pairing was easy. However, the server will NOT let you login and change some of your speaker settings due to bugs! You can login in a browser, but not on your connected iPhone or iPad apps at times. These speakers have Alexa built-in... BUT too often they fail to catch themselves being called, even in a quiet room without anything playing. Airplay 2 is nice, but then AGAIN, doesn't always work when you need it! Too many glitches. The sound quality is just as good as anything you'd expect at this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Eiríkr

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY SONOS
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY - these things are AWFUL! Complete pain to setup and failed over and over again. I set up a home system with Alexa and was pleased for one day until Alexa functionality stopped working. I had to delete and reinstall all apps related to Sonos. Did it all over again and Alexa stopped working a day later. They definitely do not have the software figured out. The wait time for tech support are hours. DO NOT BUY SONOS!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Imperfect, yet refined...
customer_reviews.text: Sure, as of January 2018 this lacks Alexa-driven Audible support. There are reasons to remind one this product is imperfect. Imperfect, yes. Refined, though. Alexa never sounded so good with this speaker's bold sound. I own (12) Sonos speakers, including two Play:3's... actually, we appreciate the Sonos One to the Play:3. The official website claims Play:3 is richer, etc. Play:1 and Sonos One are our preferred speakers. Add the flexibility of One and now you don't have to run to your tablet or smart phone to switch music. It really makes a day at home that much more joyful, it's a "killer app" that's here to stay.
customer_reviews.author: Meekile N. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Sono Is Crap
customer_reviews.text: Extremely buggy desktop software and app, poor integration with Alexa. Sonos makes many promises and rarely delivers. Sadly, I have purchased many Sonos products over the years, and I really regret the purchases. This system is never going to be stable. Sonos is too busy adding the next feature and then releasing another software update that is not yet ready for release. I would not invest Sonos and wish I never had. They really deserve to be sued.
customer_reviews.author: MMM

customer_reviews.title: This is a absolute great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a absolute great product !!!!! Sound quality is realy good lots of bass. Setup was easy . Took less then 5 minutes to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy Sonos Products! Read Below.
customer_reviews.text: Yesterday, Sonos announced that products customers have purchased in the past 2-5 years will no longer function properly after May of 2020. They are basically taking speakers and audio components customers have invested thousands of dollars into and turning them into expensive bricks destined for a landfill. You'd have to have a screw loose to spend any money on Sonos products today. What you buy right now may be phased out in the next 2 years and rendered obsolete. Look for other options and move along. Sonos thinks it's okay to have to upgrade their speakers every few years like you upgrade your smartphone. This is not a wise purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Grady

customer_reviews.title: Great but needs a bit of improvement
customer_reviews.text: First off, Sonos is amazing! I have a soundbar and love it. I am slowly adding more speakers to my loft and eventually plan to have both floors saturated with sound. This will require another 5 or 6 One's (or Play 1s) and a subwoofer. The Sonos One is a power house of a little speaker. It really fills a room. Also, Alexa works pretty well. However, I cannot give the One 5 stars until the Spotify updates come through. Additionally, they should've have made these pairable with the Play 1s. It seems silly to have two Alexa-enabled devices if you want a stereo pair.
customer_reviews.author: spinozalives

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Sound not quite what I had expected.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give it 3.5 stars. This is my first plunge into the smart speaker world. Researched extensively before purchasing. It works fine and setup went smoothly — though my family made fun of me FOR DAYS with the process of tuning the speaker to the room. Oh well. My (possibly nitpicking) complaint is I just expected richer sound from the speaker for the price. Was planning to buy 1 or 2 more for my house but now think I’ll wait. Your move BOSE!
customer_reviews.author: A. Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly timed death
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Sonos One with Alexa for a Christmas 2017 present. It died less than 3 days into 2019 - or in Sonos terms, 1 week after our one-year warranty expires. As an Alexa device, it's skills were probably about 80% - no calling/drop in feature. Most apps worked well. I've got 3 other Sonos 1 devices and one Sonos 3 that are 5+ years older that work fine. I'd suggest getting a "real" Alexa speaker for the Alexa stuff and whatever speaker, Sonos, Bose, etc., for music. The mating of the two seems to be a fail.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Wildman

customer_reviews.title: Needs Bluetooth or AirPlay. Great sound, doesn’t support what I want
customer_reviews.text: This would be perfect for people who just want to stream Spotify and nothing else. I wanted to use this as a speaker for all of my iPhone apps, but most don’t play with the Sonos app (e.g. DirecTV app, local radio app, etc). It’s also strange to me that it doesn’t seem to recognize my music in iCloud. I have to download to my phone before playing a playlist? Too bad because I love the sound & design, it just doesn’t support what I want to listen to.
customer_reviews.author: Samir

customer_reviews.title: I can't rate these as high as the common threads
customer_reviews.text: I really expected something larger. This is a small little speaker. It's quite nice. It has very nice sound, though it naturally excels toward the high end. But, there just isn't enough sound here for anything approaching a normal sized room. Maybe a small office room. They are well-built, and include lots of modern connectivity through the Sonos app. To each his/her own.
customer_reviews.author: David B Englund

customer_reviews.title: Missing an important feature
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, the Sonos will not connect with the "Play everywhere" feature available on the echo. Which means if you have multiple Echo products, you can have the same music playing on all but the Sonos. May not be an important feature for everyone but knowing it, I may have looked for alternative products.
customer_reviews.author: The Maj

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with 802.11n
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and returned right away as I found out that it does not work with 802.11n WiFi standard. I can't believe that it works only on 802.11b and g only. I could have made changes in my router to make it backward compatible, but it's not worth it when everything else is on 802.11n network. You have a product that does not work on 802.11n standard in 2018? I found this too primitive.
customer_reviews.author: Valued Amz Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Kickass Speaker
customer_reviews.text: I love this speaker! Setup was very easy. I have it set up on my 2016 MacBook Pro and my iPhone. It sounds amazing and Alexa works very well but she says some skills are not compatible. I will definitely save for another Sonos One. I also cannot wait for AirPlay 2 support; please hurry up!! Update 14July18 : Sonos now supports Airplay 2 and absolutely kicks ass even more now!! I love this speaker! I just picked up a second Sonos One and can watch Netflix and iTunes on my MacBook with stereo Sonos. Outstanding speakers.
customer_reviews.author: brandon reiter

customer_reviews.title: Wont play songs off my phone
customer_reviews.text: I used to be able to play songs off my phone, but it now says: 'Sorry, this feature is unavailable right now'. Well, it's been unavailable for several weeks. This is confirmed on their website. That was the main reason I purchased this device so it's no longer useful to me.
customer_reviews.author: G. Barbaro

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound, will get better with updates for the voice controls.
customer_reviews.text: Ultimately this has the same sound quality as the Sonos Play 1, which I had a pair of prior to buying a pair of these. I like the convenience of having the Amazon Alexa ecosystem built in; however, it is taking some time to add google home functionality. I am using both this item and Alexa in Canada so for those in the US reading this, your experience with it is probably better than mine. My rating is based solely on sound quality which is clear crisp and clean and for the size it pumps out. Looking forward to future updates to the sound quality and voice control functionality.
customer_reviews.author: kaz

customer_reviews.title: Great but Alexa falls flat
customer_reviews.text: This product offers good soubd, but not nearly as good as my definitive technology speakers. My issue and the reason im returning is the lack of zoning compatibility with other echo speakers. I could buy a lot more sonos speakers but with echo dots so cheap and with aux jacks i can add the smart and build my zones. The echo 2nd gen might not have the overall quality but it offers more bang for the price and links in seamlessly. I hope the alexa platform continues to grow and allow for better zoning. That way i can add higher end speakers in some areas while using lower in others like thw garage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It might have Alexa but just to control this one speaker....
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to add a speaker in another room to an Echo Show... However the Alexa enabled feature in the Sonos is just a way to use Alexa to control that one speaker. In the Alexa app you cant use this as part of a group since the app only supports multiple ECHO devices as a part of a multi room group. Yes you can use the Alexa app on your phone to play to the Sonos speaker, but only individually. A really stupid implementation of the Alexa capabilities. This one will get relegated to someone who just uses Sonos speakers, and I will have to replace with a real Echo. Very disappointing. Thanks for nothing Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Much better sound than Gen 2 Echo devices. Worth it if you really like music
customer_reviews.text: Great sound tho not as good as my HomePod. The Sonia app is very slick. The only con is it can’t do all of the voice activated commands that amazon Alexa deviance can do. But it can do 90% of the and it’s much “smarter” than the home pod. Sound is significantly better than gen 2 echo devices that it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: D. Picardi

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like this..great audio terrible alexa
customer_reviews.text: The integration w/ alexa is terrible. Sonos must not use the same micrphone technology because Alexa almost never heard me when the echodot it was supposed to replace worked significantly better. Also there is an audible *ding* anytime alexa hears her name and begins to listen. This is extremely annoying and it cannot be turned off. The audio quality is excellent but the amazon alexa integration is terrible. This is NOT the "best sounding alexa you can buy" as I thought it was simply because it's hardly an alexa with how terribly they integrated her.
customer_reviews.author: Ryeguy

customer_reviews.title: Total joke in the Mac world.
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this working as the output speaker for my iMac. I tried support the Internet, Sonos support, and everything else I could think of before giving up after being transferred to FIVE chat people without resolution. Don't believe me? Their names were: Richard, then Akanksha, then Saranya, then Pathan, and then Chinmay. What a joke. I think I'll just buy a HomePod.
customer_reviews.author: cjaubert

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: So I guess I didn't do my research well enough. I purchased the Sonos speaker thinking it would be able to use the same Alexa features that I use on my Alexa Echo's. Nope - no can do. And I feel like the sound quality is worse than the Echo! What a waste of money. We're going to keep it because we can use the speaker in one of our rooms but it's really disappointing that I can't even drop in to my Sonos and I haven't figure out how to make a group out of my Echo and Sonos. Really frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: jod

customer_reviews.title: Does not handle iPhone's stored music well
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is quite good and it streams well, although the app doesn't always want to come up. The problem is playing any music stored on your iPhone. The Sonos app quickly finds your music and will play it, but will cut off songs, restart other songs abruptly, and the biggest problem is that it won't play longer than 3 or 4 minutes, even after several email exchanges with the Sonos helpline. I'm back to bluetoothing my stored music on a UE Boom speaker!
customer_reviews.author: SkyHock

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality, good functionality, and looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband on his birthday. He’s been wanting one for a while and said that the sound quality was excellent. He was right! I love how we can listen to Spotify through it and I have to sign in to anything. The buttons on the top make it easy to turn it off and on, or turn the volume up and down. The white looks really good in our dining room on the shelf. I’m really impressed with the sound quality. I think we’re going to buy some more for the kitchen and other rooms in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Allison S

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful design, good sound but dysfunctional app makes system unplayable
customer_reviews.text: I own eight different Sonos speakers including Sonos One. These are beautifully designed speakers. Sound quality is as good as one can expect from a system this size. The problem is that the speakers are practically unusable if you plan on playing music from your iPhone. The app is so dysfunctional as to cause endless frustrations. Tech support, which used to be responsive and well-informed, is slow to respond and clueless as to resolving issues. Until Sonos can figure out how to produce an app that allows for playback without constant 'cut-outs'/ lost connections and randomly switching tracks among other serious issues, then I would not recommend investing in this system.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Asla

customer_reviews.title: Lack of airplay killed it for us
customer_reviews.text: Though the sound was excellent, Alexa was being activated without us using the activation word. The Amazon echo did not do this. Also, we use the echo to connect our iPad via Bluetooth and use it as an audio device for Netflix. The Sonos device doesn't support Bluetooth or airplay so it didn't meet our needs
customer_reviews.author: Sauderite

customer_reviews.title: Alexa in a much better speaker
customer_reviews.text: Received this today and began playing with it. The sound is excellent compared to the basic Google Home and Echo products. Setup was fairly easy, although not quite as excellent as the Google Home, which was even simpler. That said, it was pretty easy to set this up. If you want this primarily for convenient music play, this is almost a no brainer. Get the Sonos One and enjoy the higher quality sound, and the convenience of Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: student_cs

customer_reviews.title: Love it, I have smart lights set up throughout ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it, I have smart lights set up throughout my house through WeMo with multiple Echo Dots throughout my place. Decided to purchase the Sonos One with Alexa as opposed to one of the fancier Amazon Alexa devices. The Sonos Play:1 does everything I need it to do and was easy to set up. I'm able to control all my smart devices and the sound quality is what you'd expect from Sonos. Now i'm just waiting for AirPlay 2 to update so I can integrate the Sonos One with my other Sonos Play:5.
customer_reviews.author: W. Fu

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Fun and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: While the audio fidelity is not super great, it is plenty good enough for most occasions. I have two of these speaker operating in stereo. The best aspect of the Sonos speaker is their ease of use and excellent software. I use their app on my iPhone and MacBook. Make sure you subscribe to Amazon Prime because Sonos works super-well with Prime music! Great system for parties. Anyone with a phone can change the songs! Get a least two of these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Bajadrifter

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t have all Amazon Echo features... “yet”?
customer_reviews.text: Although I love the Sonos product lines, this one fell a bit short for me. The Alexa integration is not quite there yet. I contacted Sonos support today and received the following feedback about Amazon Cloud Cam control: “ Thank you for contacting Sonos Customer Care. I understand you are trying to control cloud cameras with the Sonos One. Currently, this feature isn't supported on the Sonos One. It may be at a later date. the Sonos One is currently designed to play music using Alexa. More features will eventually come in time however.”
customer_reviews.author: Shad Decker

customer_reviews.title: WARNING SONOS WILL NOT PLAY iTunes from an iOS device!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed you cannot play iTunes form an iOS device and when you use iTunes from your Mac it will not play mp4 format! This is crazy I can buy a $10 Bluetooth speaker that will play iTunes but this very expensive Sonos system will not, what a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: SONOS best quality in sound!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a SONOS One after having another high end compact speaker for many years. Replaced the other speaker as it was dropping connections constantly; their rep informed me it was the battery and the charge to replace was ridiculous, therefore I switched loyalties to SONOS on the recommendation of family and I am thrilled! So easy to set up; very intuitive; you don’t have to be a computer genius to set this up and it works with Alexa; the sound is as better if not better than my prior high end compact speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Cape Cod Nana

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t listen like Alexa
customer_reviews.text: 1) What I like Love the sound from this thing, it’s definitely much better than the echo plus I have. Much better audio. 2) What I don’t like Was not easy setting up, frequently just stops playing music for no reason. The worst is this thing can’t hear me when playing at moderately loud volumes (Alexa volume 4 or higher). I literally have to yell at it from across the room for voice control. My recommendation. Do not get sonos one with Alexa. Get a sonos and a separate echo that will be much better at receiving voice commands.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Grimm

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for Sonos One
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for this initial effort to merge these technologies. As a Sonos customer., integrating the One into the existing system was easy. And using Alexa to control music by voice around the home is phenomenal. While there are complaints on limited functionality...bah. buy a dot if you can't wait for updates to the platform. Sounds great. Works great. This is the future.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: SONOS makes good products and we have a several
customer_reviews.text: SONOS makes good products and we have a several. As an admitted geek, I thought it might be useful in my wife's pottery studio. It is tough to control a music system with wet clay all over your hands. So now she can give it vocal commands and It works OK but I hope they will add more functionality. A SONOS system gives you a ton of options and It will be difficult to add voice control to the complexity that SONOS offers, but the product is working well at a simple level and It is likely do more with a quick internet upgrade. I hope.
customer_reviews.author: Larryat24

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker...not so smart.
customer_reviews.text: As a speaker...WOW. the sound if wonderfully clear and crisp and as loud as you would expect. As a smart device...Wow, as in wow this sucks. The alexa is a novelty with its limited functionality and while it isn't a suprise, it can't hear you when it's plating music at a medium volume or up. I also don't know why you can't incorporate it into multiroom music with the echos. I would love to have it link up to my TV but this isn't supported either. If you want to a great wireless speaker, get this. If you care more about functionality and smart home compatability then I suggest saving some money and buying an echo.
customer_reviews.author: Domsdad

customer_reviews.title: Alexa doesn’t work at all. Better off with an echo.
customer_reviews.text: Buggy and Horrible customer service. Alexa integration doesn’t work at all. 4 hours on the phone and multiple diagnostic tests I was told my WiFi signal was bad and it could only run when plugged directly into router. I knew this was bs as it’s 10 feet from an a Netgear Orbi Kn a fiber connection. Plugging it in solved nothing and then I got the “have I solved your question?” No ok I will have to have someone call you back. Still waiting for my call. Other sonos products are great have a Play 5 and others. Can’t believe I paid so much for this thing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Great little speaker!
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because it can't tie my shoes. Nah, just kidding. Great sound at a great price. A little complicated to set up. Response to commands is somewhat mixed, but this is a developing technology and constantly being upgraded and refined. This is one product that is guaranteed to improve over time. Basic speaker are very solid with quality drivers and amps. My second One will be arriving tomorrow for stereo pairing!
customer_reviews.author: William A. Crane

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound and looks great too!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound and looks great too! The Sonos app makes it so simple to set up an entire house of speakers in less than 10 minutes! I bought 5 of these for my small bungalow house and they are fantastic! The setup was super simple in the Sonos app and Spotify works seemlessly in the app too! The addition of Alexa makes this a no-brained but if you have echo dots already than the Play 1 speaker may be a better choice as the One is exactly the same speaker but with Alexa added. I could not be happier... Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: MikeyB

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, easy walk through install. can't stereo pair with normal sonos play 1.
customer_reviews.text: Sonos sound is excellent, It's so nice to have speakers around the house playing the same song. The only detractor is that I want Alexa access in two locations in my house, because there are two spots that I don't have my phone with me to turn music on. So I got 2 alexa speakers and 2 normal ones.... they can't be paired together in stereo, but you can have two different types of speakers filling out a room. I suppose I should have bought 4 Alexa speakers. Still great sound though.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Murphy

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: Stick with you true amazon products, SONOS should be very disappointed in putting out a product that clearly does not work correctly buy does have its moments. I didn't pay for moments! Because of this poorly mad product I will now stay clear of all SONO brand products ( not saying that they all are bad) but if they make one really bad what does that say about a company.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna cohen

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! WILL BREAK IN A YEAR AND 4 MONTHS AND YOU ARE SCREWED!
customer_reviews.text: What a TERRIBLE product!!!! This is our second sonos 1...the first one didn't work right out of the box. A year and 4 months later...yep 4 months after the warranty expires...the whole thing shuts down. No lights, no power, NASA. Texted and called...wasted several hours of time...to only be told there was nothing they can do. Yes...$200 wasted. Wait....I also bought a sonos speaker to pair with the Sonos one which is now USELESS...so make that $400 wasted. Stick with the cheap echo dots that can be replaced for $20. Amazon does NOT BACK its product nor cares about their customers. Again, DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Ivette R

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound in a beautiful package; Alexa works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is our first Sonos speaker and WOW am I impressed! The sound is phenomenal for such a compact device. The Alexa integration is great and has worked perfectly in the week I’ve had it. I initially bought the new Echo with “Dolby” sound, however I was really disappointed with the lackluster sound. So I returned it for the Sonos and could not be happier! Way worth the extra bucks if you have it. I’m eager to add to the Sonos collection down the road to enable seamless whole home audio. Don’t listen to the reviewers criticizing he Alexa integration; user error! Buy this thing, you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: George Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Not an Echo device
customer_reviews.text: This is a great speaker and works well with Alexa voice commands. Just be aware that it is NOT an echo device and does not have the same functionality or access to features. Anything that says it works with Echo will not necessarily work with the Sonos One. Specifically, you can not have a Music Unlimited plan for Echo connected to this speaker. If you sign up for the trial Individual Music Unlimited plan you will not be able to "downgrade Music unlimited" to the Echo plan with the Sonos One. Also, I haven't verified but I doubt it works with other devices like Echo buttons.
customer_reviews.author: M. Huntress

customer_reviews.title: Sonos is the real deal.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. I have purchased 2 more since buying this, and am slowly planning on buying at least one for each room in my house. Yes, Sonos is more expensive that other bluetooth speakers, but the sound quality far exceeds any other speakers that I have heard. Can't recommend Sonos enough.
customer_reviews.author: G.J. Head

customer_reviews.title: Sound is excellent. Alexa integration is "ok" -- we have both ...
customer_reviews.text: ok purchased two of these. Sound is excellent. Alexa integration is "ok" -- we have both an iphone and a android Samsung phone as controllers. Still some issues: 1) have to be a Spotify premium member to use this speaker with Spotify 2) iphone podcast don't play well with Alexa. There is an "anypod skill" I enabled but it doesn't work (no sound). 3) ambient sound skills and many "3rd party" sound skills don't play. The instructions play but not the sound loops! I hope these things get fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Gma Susan

customer_reviews.title: Best sounding smart speaker on the market!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Does exactly what Sonos says it will do. After setup I even received an email from Sonos with advice on some cool Alexa skills and the time line for when they will be releasing more advanced features. Best sounding smart speaker on the market hands down
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: going with Sonos is your best bet. Very easy to setup and add on ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a whole home audio system, going with Sonos is your best bet. Very easy to setup and add on new rooms at any time. Started with my living room and now I have one in my bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, garage, office, and sunroom. Then got a connect amp to add speakers around my pool. Only downside is that they have to be plugged into an outlet and you need great wifi or CAT-5 outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Kip Stovall

customer_reviews.title: I love this speaker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this once I learned that it was linked to Alexa and it has the best sounds of any speaker in our house. Great sound ... good Alexa functionality. And easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Edel

customer_reviews.title: Adds Alexa to a Sonos system
customer_reviews.text: Ever since before I purchased my first Sonos system several years ago, I have wanted to be able to say "Play Willie Nelson in the Living Room" and have it do that. Well, with the new Sonos One in my office (in the house), I can do just that! And I love it! I say, "Alexa, play Willie Nelson in the Living Room" and it does!! Plus, the new Sonos One seems to be even better sound quality than my other Sonos speakers. I love the entire system even more now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound
customer_reviews.text: This speaker has incredible sound quality and is very loud for the price. I was never a fan of the old sonos because they weren't Bluetooth enabled but this thing with Alexa is great. Pandora and Spotify don't always continue playing on the device like other devices but I am not sure if that's a sonos thing or pandora/spotify thing. Either way, great buy and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dobber

customer_reviews.title: dont expect alexa to do 100% of what she does as an echo device alone
customer_reviews.text: I like these. Ive always wanted sonos speakers and alexa but i was worried to try either out because of the price. I was able to get the 2 pack deal that came with a $50 amazon gift card. I love the sound on these but Alexa doesnt seem to be able to hear me over loud music. In any case I am now getting more alexas for other rooms. since these are in my main living areas I dont think i will be buying any more sonos speakers at least not for a very long time. Love the speakers. This is not a true alexa device as in it does not have all the features Alexa would.
customer_reviews.author: lvilla

customer_reviews.title: be advised, it's name is ALEXA
customer_reviews.text: Too bad that's my daughter's name. Other Amazon Alexa products let you change it's name. Not this one. Make's the Amazon capability useless at my house. Sonos says Amazon is forcing them to use the name Alexa. And using Siri to play music on it is wonky. Might as well just pick up my phone rather than arguing with it. This is the first Sonos product I don't love. Might return it.
customer_reviews.author: JPD

customer_reviews.title: Get 2 “Ones” for great music.
customer_reviews.text: We love the sound of these and glad we opted for 2 “Ones” over a single Play 3. Found space in the kitchen, since we are always there. Even though the main stereo is in the next room, it is nice have these so close. The separation is great, and it fills up a good size kitchen with quality music. Set-up was easier, the second time around. Do not skip the True Tuning. Love the product. Alexa is a little weak, but she will grow on us...
customer_reviews.author: Pam Burton

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We are loving the addition of this speaker in our home. The sound quality is incredible and having Alexa built in is a great added bonus. We use this feature daily (my 3 year old is obsessed) and are looking forward to the addition of Spotify this December. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Best Wifi/bluetooth speakers i have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best Wifi/bluetooth speakers i have ever owned.The sound quality is great .The added bonus is having some Alexa ,although it does not have all the Alexa features. I own two of these and I am very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Was looking to buy an Amazon Echo and purchase a speaker to pair up for each room in our house. Then I discovered the Sonos with Alexa built in. This is by far the way to go. Sound quality is excellent. If your looking for an awesome standalone or room to room speaker setup look no further. And really enjoying the built in Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Sounds awesome works great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little speaker. I was going to get an Apple speaker but I tried this and am glad I did. It works with Air Play 2, so I can play stuff from Siri and Apple Music.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah G.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME Addition
customer_reviews.text: Nothing bad here. Purchased 2 of these to add to the Beam. Easy install. WOW, the sound and stereo separation is awesome. Was going to purchase the sub as well but it’s not necessary. Turn on loudness and set the bass control up and it’s just great. Forget the bad reviews and I really do not give a squat if Alexa or if some people are having problems with the software etc....after all, the sound is the important factor.
customer_reviews.author: tecwerks

customer_reviews.title: Solid Smart Speaker / Sounds Great as Stereo Pair / Easy Setup /
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 Sonos One’s to use as a stereo pair in our kitchen as an extension of our Sonos environment. Setup could not have been easier, including Alexa integration. The sound quality of a single Sonos One is pretty good, but this becomes very good when configured as a stereo pair. Sonos software for Mac/PC and iPhone/iPad is good, though the iOS app is a little clunky for changing music sources and speaker groups. Also, the Alexa functionality is very cool, but actually controlling Sonos music can be frustrating. All-in-all, very pleased with the Sonos One.
customer_reviews.author: oa7016

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound at Medium levels
customer_reviews.text: This has great sound quality at medium levels (perhaps measuring with a sound meter would have been better feedback but I don'a have one). If you play at highest volume the woofer sounds go for a toss. Another problem is that you can't add this speaker (Alexa on this speaker) into 'Everywhere' group. I don't know if this is a Sonos limitation or Amazon's but currently I was able to add only Amazon Echo devices into 'Everywhere' group. Other than that, for a medium sound levels in a small/medium sized room, this is a great speaker.
customer_reviews.author: GAkkin

customer_reviews.title: ALEXA NOW RESPONDS FLAWLESSLY AFTER SOFTWARE UPDATE!!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box both Sonos One's did have issues w/ Alexa not responding on command, but after the software update they received last month Dec 2017, it has been night and day! I have an Ecobee4 thermostat which also has Alexa integrated and when I summon Alexa to the Ecobee4 sometimes the Sonos One's are the ones that respond. Now these guys are ready for Alexa commands. As far as sound quality, that has never changed, they are absolutely superb!!
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: unable to connect iPhone to speaker
customer_reviews.text: Set up took about 20 minutes. Not terrible. Sound was great. I used it about three times. Tonight (Saturday) when I attempted to use the speaker, I received a message "Sonos system cannot be found." Wen through the setup again, but was unable to connect my phone to the speaker. There is no customer support on weekends. Sent an email. Will see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: David Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Drops songs midway through.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this speaker. I have a Sonos Connect which works very well and am very happy with. Unfortunately, I am dissatisfied after one day of use with the Sonos speaker. I have an Apple Homepod and it's sound is supremely better. The Homepod setup went smoother. I have had a Slacker account which I've had for years. The Sonos One dropped songs midway continuously. I would have liked to use the Sonos One on a daily basis. Really. Having just printed the return label, it is going back to Amazon tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Gms08

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speaker.  Not so great Alexa capability.
customer_reviews.text: We love our Sonos speakers but the Alexa part leaves something to be desired. We didn't realize that the Alexa attached to the speaker is mostly only good for music related issues. We would have been better off with an Echo Dot and a regular Alexa speaker. We moved this speaker to a different room and bought a new speaker and an Echo Dot for the kitchen where we are more likely to want to ask Alexa for more than assistance with music.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: The Sonos One sounds great and is easy to set up. It works well enough with Alexa but I'm not surprised that Amazon doesn't allow it the capabilities of one of its proprietary echo devices. I am going to buy another one because it functions well as a multi-room speaker and incorporates well with airplay 2 devices which I use as multi-room devices. They most disappointing thing is that it can't be added to Amazon's everywhere speaker group. Hopefully Amazon will allow Sonos to rectify that.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur A Wilson III

customer_reviews.title: No longer works seamlessly with iOS
customer_reviews.text: Sonos partnered up with Amazon to offer Alexa voice commands and it screwed up all of the iPhone functionality: no longer able to control volume, fast forward, rewind, etc. from the lock screen on the iPhone. Just a horrible user experience. If you use iTunes as your primary music source and have an AppleTV, do yourself a favor and just get an Apple HomePod. I own over 20 Sonos speakers and the fact that this functionality is no longer available since they implemented Alexa is just bad. I will be replacing each Sonos speaker one at a time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Works... mostly, but needs improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Getting the Sonos One working seamlessly with Alexa is an exercise in futility - hopefully software upgrades will improve the user experience... It often tells me I need to enable the Sonos app (which has been done numerous times) if I ask it to play a certain station created on Pandora. The only workaround is to use the Alexa app to get to the Pandora stations and select it the old fashion way by clicking on it rather than by voice - first world problems to be sure - so I'm not sweating it too much...
customer_reviews.author: Charles Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Very temperamental
customer_reviews.text: So, I have a love-hate relationship with these Sonos speakers. They do sound amazing, but...They randomly stop playing ALL THE TIME and they seem to have to be plugged in to work!!!!!! If you move any of the speakers AT ALL, they will shut off. I’ve had to go through the cumbersome process of re-adding them to my devices at least once a week. I need to call the company, but when I try, I am on home for 40 minutes and give up. Unless there’s something I am doing wrong, I honestly might return them
customer_reviews.author: kristendavis

customer_reviews.title: Clear, bell-like sound. Responsive voice control.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace a four-year old Libratone. The sound is incomparably better. No fuzziness at high volumes. Live instruments sound actually live. Fills medium-sized room with clear, bell-like sound. Alexa was easy to set up with first speaker. But something went wrong with the second one and we had to start over. Minor hiccup. Alexa is responsive 100% of the time when music is playing, unlike Siri and Google Home. Now works with Airplay 2, so there is literally no device or audio source that cannot be easily played through this speaker. Cute, too. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Shambhavi Sarasvati

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing speaker with amazing sound. I was hesitant on getting this speaker but after listening to my friend's, I got it. I do sometimes have an issue with the app, where it'll display an error message when selecting a song. But that's an app issue and can be resolved via update and that's not enough to make a drop a star. If you are debating on it, don't be. This is will great purchase that you'll be thanking yourself you made.
customer_reviews.author: Lenin Tejada

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate, you wont be disappointed this speaker out proforms my Bose !
customer_reviews.text: I love this speaker even more than I thought I would. Makes my other famous named speaker sound sad! Easy to set up, easy to use, can control from my phone and tablet....Alexa ....she is my alarm clock, my timer, my appointment reminder, she remembers my shopping list, she reads to me, she plays great music too. If your afraid of privacy you can easily shut off her “ears”. Love love this speaker!
customer_reviews.author: Lollie 2013

customer_reviews.title: Not Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Fine as a speaker. Does not replace Echo devices in versatility. Also, need to go through 3rd party for Alexa setup (I.e. Not a native Alexa device) = potential security risk plus one more account that cannot easily be deleted. Returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: Denver Doc

customer_reviews.title: we love the Sonos with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: we love the Sonos with Alexa. Alexa works just the same as she does natively on the Amazon Echo, but with MUCH higher sound quality. fills the room with rich deep sound. set up took less than 10 minutes. download the Sono's and Amazon Alexa app, log in to your preferred music streaming service, and boom, its done. only complaint is Alexa defaults to Amazon music service but i prefer the Spotify service. im sure there's a setting to have Alexa default to Spotify only, need to mess around with the app setting a bit more. Sono's finally gave Alexa the sound she deserves
customer_reviews.author: DSG

customer_reviews.title: Pinch me -- this product is too good to be true, but it is!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Sound, Easy to setup and pair with other Sonos, and the app is awesome! I bought five One's as individual pieces for my my multi-room goal of music everywhere and it worked flawlessly. I honestly cannot say enough how happy I am with Sonos -- really cool company, really incredible product-line! I love that the app allows me to control grouping speakers, individual sound levels, and syncs easily with both Amazon and Apple Music subs. And it states clearly Audible support is coming, so soon-ish I can have my Audio-books play through-out my home!
customer_reviews.author: Zeddicus 2018

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My Sonos One ended up being a POS. When I first purchased it the speaker worked properly. Sonos then came with a few"updates" . It then started losing some functions. I worked with Sonos for months trying to fix it. They said it was my internet. I have other devices in my house that stream off the internet and only one did not work. The Sonos One. I regret buying that product.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but not really a “smart” speaker
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: The speaker sounds great! However, I highly discourage anyone interested in this for an Alexa enabled device. I have returned this speaker since it was primarily used for Alexa which is more likely to error than work. I was hesitant to purchase based on reviews. Co-workers said they weren’t experiencing issues like the reviews were stating. I’ll agree with the general theme of the negative reviews: Alexa integration is glitchy at best. After 2 weeks of use, I’ve had to reboot the speaker twice (that is likely a Sonos issue). Some Alexa commands work and other commands are acknowledged, but then Alexa comes back with an error twice for each failure.
customer_reviews.author: CptnPinky

customer_reviews.title: I hate to say it but do not buy this model
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Sono one original for about 3 years and it's great. I bought this model to upgrade/add a room but it cannot hold a connection; repeatedly drops after a few minutes. I've exhausted troubleshooting and did a hard reboot but no luck. For being marketed as a wifi speaker at a rather premium price it is a complete fail in my opinion. Perhaps mine is faulty but was unable to get it corrected. I'd recommend going with the older model; sound is outstanding and has never once loss a connection.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Zwicke

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Sound System
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two and synced them into a set of stereo speakers. I estimate that the total old fashioned wattage equivalent is around 100 watts of power of sound. More than adequate for most stereo needs. The interface to Alexa is excellent. Ability to select the sound system within apps has always been perfect. YouTube, Spotify, iHeart, and many other apps easily connect.
customer_reviews.author: John Doughtry

customer_reviews.title: Too Many Issues
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this Sonos for about a year and hate it. The sound is great but keeping it on-line and Alexa responding has been a chore. And as other reviewers have mentioned the steps needed to get both the Alexa app and the Sonos app communicating and in sync is confusing and frustrating. She is currently not responding after the most recent update and I’m waiting on Sonos help desk to tell me why and how to fix it again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Echo with a great voice.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Sonos system, you'll love this. Be sure to use a mobile device to set it up. The Sonos app on a computer will not enable Alexa and you'll end up calling Sonos support.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Barthel

customer_reviews.title: Use free music service? Don’t bother then...
customer_reviews.text: Speaker outstanding. Customer service not quite so. Alexa integration is very poor considering you can ONLY play continuous music from music service providers when your a PAID subscriber. So if you have free pandora, amazon music, etc. You will not be able to use Alexa to play music for you, so you might as well save a couple of bucks and get the ones without Alexa integrated. Really disappointed, I was looking forward to using Alexa to automate my home.
customer_reviews.author: Luis G.

customer_reviews.title: A near perfect smart speaker
customer_reviews.text: I am a long time Sonos user and have them throughout my house along with echos. The Sonos one is a good combination of the two. The Sonos One is the right idea. I have this Sonos in the bathroom and love just telling Alexa to play whatever while I'm taking a shower. My only complaint is that my bedside echo also hears me and doesn't defer to the bathroom one. They both play. Nothing wrong with the speaker just that the echo and Sonos don't play nice. Also, I would really like if the Sonos One would pair with my Play 1's. When they add these, it will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great smart speaker - excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: If you are in the market for a Bluetooth speaker or a high fidelity smart speaker look no further than Sonos. NOTE - it isn't bluetooth but you won't need it. Recently purchased the Sonos 1 and am abundantly impressed. Amazon Alexa and the Google Assistant. Clean modern design. And the audio quality is unmatched in this price range. The 1 also serves as a "brain" meaning you can add other Sonos speakers to the network and use the 1 has the control module. It is rare to be impressed by a product nowadays. Sonos has hit the mark for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui

customer_reviews.title: Present for my husband - he is happy!
customer_reviews.text: The sound on this little thing is impressive. It really fills up a room without taking up too much space. We are still playing with the other abilities (Alexa), so I will update as we find out more, but so far it is a big hit.
customer_reviews.author: betweentheworlds

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and quality build
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound and quality build. I ended up buying 2 of these because I loved it so much. Easy setup has you listening in about 5 minutes. Alexa on the sonos still has some hiccups and doesn’t perform all the skills as an amazon echo does but hopefully updates will take care of that.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Two Thumbs Up for the Sonos One
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm loving the Sonos One. I use the Sonos One primarily as a speaker for music. I was pleased to find numerous free radio stations to use. I have not had trouble with basic Alexa functions. At this time there is no interruptions through WIFI. Also connections to Audible and Spotify are seamless. I use the speaker in a moderate size apt and there is more than adequate volume and sound quality to fill the apt.
customer_reviews.author: New Yorker

customer_reviews.title: Good, but needs software updates!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to replace my Echo. Sounds is crisp and clear. Much better than the Echo. There is one problem. For some reason the music starts before Alexa stops talking. The music shouldn't start until Alexa is done speaking. I wish there was a way with the equalizer to improve the mids. All you can adjust is treble and bass right now. Once the playing problem is fixed, my rating will go up.
customer_reviews.author: dfine1966

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sound Coupled with Smart Agent
customer_reviews.text: A great speaker combined with an interactive agent - what is not to love? We listen to streaming music through it and enjoy that function. With all the news stories lately and the Amazon and Google products it is a bit annoying hearing it respond to the TV. Also, when it is streaming music it is often hard to get it to respond to a new request (such as terminating the music stream). Overall we are very happy with this "intelligent" speaker (but what else is it hearing? LOL)
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: It might be a lovely silent brick sooner than you think.
customer_reviews.text: Who knows when this will cease to be supported now that they’re killing off speakers some people bought just 3-4 years ago (or sooner!) by discontinuing support. It’s a speaker, not an iPhone. I expect a long use period, and I have no confidence in that now.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality top notch and setup very easy
customer_reviews.text: If this device had a small battery to enable moving it around the house or even outside on nice days it would be the perfect speaker. Sound quality is superior, the volume is unbelievablely great and easily changed, attaching to many apps is simple. Alexa makes it easy, the app on phone or table is intuitive, just a well made device that I hope will be around for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey McCauley

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, easy to set up, looks great in the kitchen (this is part of a pair). Stereo setup was easy and sounds great. However, Alexa is not the most easy to use application because requires "plug-in's" to work with the applications that you may want to use, such as weather and traffic.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Works and sounds great!
customer_reviews.text: this is my first sonos device (so no issues connecting older ones that some have mentioned) and it is freakin' awesome! Alexa play "Take Five", Alex play "Eric Clapton", Alexa play "blues"...whatever, it was a bit of an effort to set up so it was connected to my services (Amazon Music and Pandora) but once that's done it works and sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Sonos is great, but Alexa misses the mark with this one
customer_reviews.text: I like that it’s a Sonos speaker. I have several and love how easy it is to connect them together. It’s the Alexa part of it that sucks. Why is it that a speaker cannot do any audio playback skills? For instance, if you have the flash briefing as part of a routine (“good morning”), it doesn’t work. I ended up turning off the Alexa microphone and put an echo dot right next to it. I wish I would’ve bought another Play 1 instead, it’s cheaper and I’d be able to use it with my other one for surround sound.
customer_reviews.author: drsharkette

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 2 of these speakers about 6 months ago. Great investment and would definitely buy again. They sound great and EQ is adjustable for each one. I don't have any skipping or connectivity issues whatsoever. I didn't enable Alexa and it is a definite plus that there is an option to leave disabled. The app works pretty well for me but I do wish there was a way to directly connect with Android. For Apple users you can use Airplay which I do on my Mac laptop. I'm looking forward to getting a soundbar sometime in the near future. This is a good company with great quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Garonzik

customer_reviews.title: Horrible reliability
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good - when they work. But they almost never work. Airplay or direct music play via the Sonos app rarely works, both for streaming music or music from my own library. Sometimes music plays for a few seconds then drops out. More frequently, it says it’s playing and no music comes out. These speakers are based on outdated wireless technology. Go elsewhere. Horrendous value. Poor reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin, Simon, Fyodor

customer_reviews.title: Avoid. It doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: It just doesn’t work. Alexa has to be reinstalled every few days. Usually can’t connect to the app on my iPhone X. Usually doesn’t work with Airplay. Basically useless. Sonos’s “Solutions” to these problems are ridiculous: basically, reboot. But the real solution is to uninstall and reinstall Alexa. The Airplay problems seem totally random — and have no solution.
customer_reviews.author: Tunbridge Wells

product_meta.title: Sonos One (Gen 1) - Voice Controlled Smart Speaker (White) (Discontinued by manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Color:White| Style:1 SpeakerSonos One blends great sound with Amazon Alexa, the easy to use voice service, for hands free control of your music and more. Use your voice to play songs while you cook. Tell Alexa to turn the volume up while you’re in the shower. You can even request your favorite lullaby when you’re tucking the kids in.

Sonos One connects with Amazon Alexa easily over Wi Fi. Just set up the speaker, select the Sonos skill in the Amazon Alexa app, and you’re all set to play music, get news and answers, manage your smart devices, and enjoy everything else Alexa does using nothing but your Sonos One.

Since Alexa responds to any voice, anyone in your home can take charge of the music. Kids can call out their favorite sing alongs. Friends can skip or replay tracks and adjust audio settings, no app required. Party guests can request their favorite songs in real time. No matter who says it, Sonos plays it.
feature_bullets: Sonos One - The powerful smart speaker with voice control built in.
This product has been replaced by Sonos One (Gen 2).

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,163 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
